CatDescriptText: Perry Black, Clerk, 212 Mueller Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 2, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you believe Negroes, who get public assistance, do more cheating than whites?" answer reads: "No, I don't think so. I think that is it about 50:50 when you consider race."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Perry Black wearing hat with braided band, eyeglasses, dark dot patterned necktie, and light colored coat, standing on sidewalk with two women in front of stone building with doors on right
